title.narrative: NPM understand and address situations of vulnerabilities in detention
Increased number of NPMs that issue thematic reports and/or include specific chapters to their annual reports on vulnerabilities in detention.

target.value: At least 3 NPMs have strengthen their capacities in monitoring the situation of LGBTI persons deprived of liberty through in-country workshops to disseminate the practical guide.

actual.value: - A roundtable on women and prison held in Geneva with experts and practitioners, promoting a gender-sensitive perspective across the whole prison system. APT led discussions with experts, NGOs and the NPM on protection measures for LGBTI detainees in Panama and in Brazil, where APT also took part at a hearing at the Congress. - In Romania, APT trained the NPM in monitoring psychiatric institutions, which laid the ground for specific cooperation with authorities.

title.narrative: Relevant stakeholders work towards a better understanding of safeguards
Relevant stakeholders work towards a better understanding of safeguards

target.value: -The draft of the guidelines on investigative interviewing and associated safeguards is finalized. -60 States are aware of the draft of the Guidelines -The implementation of procedural safeguards in Brazil. Madagascar and Thailand has concretely advanced. -3 NPMs have reinforced their capacities in monitoring procedural safeguards in the first hours of detention.

actual.value: - Development of an Action Toolkit in Thailand to disseminate information about rights and notification of family among authorities and Thai public. - Pilot project in the four main police stations of the capital in Madagascar, testing new custody registers and a Letter of rights (read and handed over to each arrested person). - Training of lawyers in Lebanon on their role in preventing torture and ill-treatment. - APT facilitated dialogue with authorities, other state institutions and civil society in Mexico and Paraguay, to advance the implementation of safeguards in practice.
